required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Chitodex Gel vs NexFoam on Post-operative Outcomes in the Treatment of Chronic Rhinosinusitis
clinical_study.official_title: Head to Head Comparison of Chitodex Gel With Triamcinolone vs NexFoam With Triamcinalone on Post-operative Outcomes in the Treatment of Chronic Rhinosinusitis (CRS)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and outcomes of Chitodex gel plus Kenalog versus Nexfoam plus Kenalog in patients with chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) undergoing sinus surgery. Both dressings are already known to be beneficial in controlling postoperative bleeding and promote wound healing.
The trial will be single blinded randomized controlled trial and patients recruited will undergo endoscopic sinus surgery as standard of care for treatment of CRS. Specific outcome measures will be objective and subjective outcome scores post surgery as shown on attached forms.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients eligible and consented to participate will be randomized towards the end of surgery (just before applying the nasal dressing) to determine which nostril will receive 10 mL of Chitodex gel plus Kenalog inserted into the middle meatus and which will receive NexFoam plus Kenalog.

primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured based on the wound healing in the sinus openings made during surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Symptom Scores on Patients' Self-Directed Questionnaires

arm_group.description: Chitodex gel plus Kenalog inserted into the middle meatus
NexFoam plus Kenalog inserted into the middle meatus

intervention.description: post-operative dressing within standard of care
post-operative dressing within standard of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Those who have had symptoms of chronic rhinosinusitis (nasal discharge, postnasal drip, nasal obstruction, facial pain and pressure, lack of sense of smell) that has been previously persistent for greater than 3 months AND
2. ≥ 18 years to ≤ 90 years AND
3. English speaking AND
4. are able to give written informed consent AND
5. are local and who will be returning to this center for postoperative follow-up care AND
6. are indicated to undergo endoscopic sinus surgery and willing to return at 2-4, 6-8 & 12 (± 2) weeks post-op.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. allergy to shellfish
2. pregnant or breastfeeding
3. Hepatitis or blood disorders
4. any drug allergy
5. allergy to potato starch (due to Nexfoam)

reference.citation: Ngoc Ha T, Valentine R, Moratti S, Robinson S, Hanton L, Wormald PJ. A blinded randomized controlled trial evaluating the efficacy of chitosan gel on ostial stenosis following endoscopic sinus surgery.
